subject: Primitive types in method arguments: PrivilegedAccessor
msgSnippet: I added a method to Privileged accessor that makes it easier to call a function whose arguments are of primitive types. Hope this saves time for someone using
messageBody:
I added a method to Privileged accessor that makes it easier to call a
function whose
arguments are of primitive types. Hope this saves time for someone using
it :)

/**
* Calls a method on the given object instance with the given
arguments.
* When mtehod arguments are of primitive types type
* boxing will make it impossible to acess them, so use this version
*
* @param instance
* the object instance
* @param methodName
* the name of the method to invoke
* @param args
* an array of objects to pass as arguments
* @see PrivilegedAccessor#invokeMethod(Object,String,Object)
*
* Ramon Talavera: Ramon.Talavera@...
*/

public static Object invokeMethod_use_primitive_types_in_args(
Object instance, String methodName, Object[] args)
throws NoSuchMethodException, IllegalAccessException,
InvocationTargetException {
Class[] classTypes = null;
if (args != null) {
classTypes = new Class[args.length];
for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
if (args[i] != null) {
classTypes[i] = args[i].getClass();
if (classTypes[i] == Integer.class)
classTypes[i] = Integer.TYPE;
else
if (classTypes[i] == Long.class)
classTypes[i] = Long.TYPE;
else
if (classTypes[i] == Short.class)
classTypes[i] = Short.TYPE;
else
if (classTypes[i] == Double.class)
classTypes[i] = Double.TYPE;
else
if (classTypes[i] == Float.class)
classTypes[i] = Float.TYPE;
else
if (classTypes[i] == Boolean.class)
classTypes[i] = Boolean.TYPE;
else
if (classTypes[i] == Byte.class)
classTypes[i] = Byte.TYPE;


}
}
}

Method method=getMethod(instance, methodName, classTypes);
if (method==null)
return null;

return method.invoke(instance,
args);
}
